Unless otherwise provided herein, the following words and terms used in this
Contract shall have the meanings set forth below:
Article 2
"Affiliate" means, in relation to Party A, any enterprise or other entity which,
directly or indirectly, controls, or is controlled by, Party A; the term

perturbation.changed_text:
Unless otherwise provided herein, the following words and terms used in this Contract shall have the meanings set forth below:
Article 2
"Affiliate" means, in relation to Party A, any enterprise or other entity which, directly or indirectly, controls, or is controlled by, Party A; the term "control" meaning ownership of seventy-five percent (75%) or more of the registered capital or voting stock.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'control' for Party A's affiliates is changed from 50% ownership to 75%. This creates a direct contradiction, as other sections of the contract may rely on the original 50% threshold. For example, if a clause restricts Party A from engaging in certain activities through its affiliates, the change in definition creates ambiguity as to which entities are bound by this restriction.

perturbation.original_text:
Article 42
Party A and Party B shall sign the Contract for Technology Investment
simultaneously with the signature of this Contract, and pursuant to the Contract
for Technology Investment shall license to the Joint Venture Company the right
to utilize proprietary technology (including patented technology), related
documentation and know-how for the production of the Joint Venture Products.
The Contract for Technology Investment is attached hereto as Appendix 2.

The technology license fee of Five Million Nine Hundred Thousand United States
Dollars (US$5,900,000) shall be deemed to be paid by the Joint Venture Company
and shall constitute part of Party B's contribution to the registered capital of
the Joint Venture Company in accordance with Article 32 of this Contract. The
Contract for Technology Investment shall be signed by the Parties simultaneously
with the signing of this Joint Venture Contract and shall come into effect upon
its approval by the Examination and Approval Authority. The Board of Directors
shall ratify the Contract for Technology Investment at the first meeting of the
Board of Directors.

Party B and the Joint Venture Company shall comply with the provisions of the
Contract for Technology Investment, and Party B further warrants that the
technology provided in accordance with the Contract for Technology Investment is
complete, correct, effective and can fulfil the technological goals set forth in
the Contract for Technology Investment.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 42
Party A and Party B shall sign the Contract for Technology Investment simultaneously with the signature of this Contract, and pursuant to the Contract for Technology Investment shall license to the Joint Venture Company the right to utilize proprietary technology (including patented technology), related documentation and know-how for the production of the Joint Venture Products. The technology license fee shall be determined at a later date.

Party B and the Joint Venture Company shall comply with the provisions of the Contract for Technology Investment, and Party B further warrants that the technology provided in accordance with the Contract for Technology Investment is complete, correct, effective and can fulfil the technological goals set forth in the Contract for Technology Investment.
perturbation.explanation: The technology license fee of Five Million Nine Hundred Thousand United States Dollars (US$5,900,000) is removed. Since the technology license fee constitutes part of Party B's contribution to the registered capital of the Joint Venture Company in accordance with Article 32 of this Contract, this creates ambiguity. Also, if the the parties agree to be valued at US$5,900,000 is ommitted, it creates uncertainty and undermines the foundation upon which Party B's contribution is determined. This omission introduces an internal contradiction between the outlined responsibilities and the financial contributions expected from each party.

perturbation.original_text:
Article 76
Matters relating to the recruitment, wages, insurance, welfare, dismissal of the staff and workers of the Joint Venture Company shall be handled in accordance with the LABOR LAW OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA and the REGULATIONS OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA ON LABOR MANAGEMENT IN FOREIGN INVESTMENT ENTERPRISES and related PRC regulations. The Joint Venture Company's internal labor policies shall be established pursuant to relevant PRC laws and regulations, and approved by the Board of Directors.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 76
Matters relating to the recruitment, wages, insurance, welfare, dismissal of the staff and workers of the Joint Venture Company shall be handled in accordance with general business practices. The Joint Venture Company's internal labor policies shall be established at the discretion of the CEO, without requiring Board approval.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to the LABOR LAW OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA and related regulations, and instead referencing general business practices creates a conflict. It gives the impression that the company is now not required to follow PRC labor laws when recruiting, dismissing or paying employees. By saying that labor policies shall be established at the discretion of the CEO, without requiring Board approval, directly contradicts the article 54 that the senior management personnel of the joint venture company needs unanimous approval.
